context_0.vignette: Heinz's wife has recently fallen ill and needs an expensive medication that is not covered by her medical insurance. They do not have the money needed to purchase the expensive prescription medication, but they know that it is vital for her to have it if she is going to recover.
context_0.prompt: One thing that Heinz could do is to
generation: sell some of their possessions, like a car or jewelry, to gather the needed money
consider a few different options:
explore different sources of financial aid
reach out to the pharmaceutical company distributing the medication
seek financial assistance from friends, family, or charitable organizations
set up a crowdfunding campaign to help raise the necessary funds

explore various options like speaking to the doctor about possible alternatives to the expensive medication, looking into patient assistance programs, trying to secure a medical loan, negotiating the price with the pharmacy or directly with the pharmaceutical company, starting a crowdfunding campaign, or seeking help from non-profit organizations that provide financial aid for medical treatments
seek help from friends, family, or community organizations to raise the needed money
seek out non-profit organizations or funds specifically designed to help individuals with high cost medical bills
apply for financial assistance through nonprofit organizations or patient assistance programs that help cover the cost of expensive medication

context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. Now Josh is sitting in his car near a busy intersection, and knows he needs to get to airport soon if he is going to catch his flight.
context_1.prompt: One thing that Josh could do is to

call a taxi or Uber to take him to the airport
call for a taxi, Uber, or other ride-sharing service to pick him up and take him to the airport
call a taxi or rideshare service such as Uber or Lyft to take him to the airport
call for a taxi, Uber, or any other ride-hailing service

context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. take money out of his own pocket to make up the difference in the register
pay the missing $50

pay the missing amount from his own pocket
put his own money into the register to make up for the missing amount
use his own money to make up for the missing amount

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.
context_4.prompt: One thing that Mary could do is to
generation: contact her mom and ask her to bring the homework to school, if possible
quickly call or text her mom to bring the homework to school if possible

explain the situation to her teacher immediately after the class starts or during the break, present any proof she might have (for example a photo of the completed homework, drafts, notes), and then ask for an extension
speak to the teacher, explain the situation and ask if she can submit her homework a bit later
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the homework
call her mom and ask her to quickly bring the assignment to school before the class starts
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for an extension to submit the assignment
explain the situation to her teacher and ask for extra time to bring in the homework
email her teacher to explain the situation and ask if they might allow her to submit the homework the following day
immediately call or message her mom, asking her to bring the homework to school if possible

context_5.vignette: Brad and some friends are hiking through the mountains in the Canadian wilderness. A couple of days into their hike, Brad realizes that they are lost. He knows that a rescue crew could arrive before long, but it is extremely cold and they don't have much food or water left.
context_5.prompt: One thing that Brad could do is to
generation: construct a basic shelter using sticks and leaves to protect them from the elements, and then focus on finding a clean, fresh source of water
build a fire for warmth and to signal rescuers, ration out their remaining food and water supplies while considering alternate sources
start rationing the supplies they have left
gather his group together and try to create a basic survival plan
prioritize building a shelter for warmth and protection from the elements
build a fire to keep warm, melt snow for water, and find whatever edible flora and fauna he could to supplement their food while they wait for rescue
attempt to find a source of water like a stream or river, ration their remaining food, and create a visible signal for rescuers
start a fire to stay warm, signal for help and to melt snow for water
create a signal for help
construct a temporary shelter using materials around them to protect against the cold
